bioghist.p: Benjamin Clemens Stone (1933-1994) was curator of the Department of Botany at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia from 1984 to 1989. He was a noted expert on the flora of Southeast Asia, and was one of the major collectors of Pandanaceae specimens. He received his Ph.D. in botany from the University of Hawaii in 1961. Prior to joining the Academy, he had been a lecturer in Botany at the University of Malaya, Kuala Lumpur, and was on the staff of the University of Guam.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Benjamin Stone. Materials include: offices files, including resumes and applications for curator positions, budget documents, research proposals, and minutes from committee meetings; "A classification of the Genus Pandanus" handwritten chart, rolled; a typed draft of "The Summit Flora of Gunung Ulu Kali (Pahand, Malaysia)" and galley proofs of manuscripts on Pandanus; an article by Stone entitled "The Vegetation and Flora of Malaya," 1971; reprints; a list of plants in New Jersey; checklists of plants in the Marshall Islands and Guam; and journals, brochures and reference materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
